text.section: A "certificate of authority" is one issued by the commissioner evidencing the authority of an insurer to transact insurance in this state.

A "license" is authority granted by the commissioner pursuant to this code authorizing the licensee to engage in a business or operation of insurance in this state other than as an insurer, and the certificate by which such authority is evidenced.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 910, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 301, subtit. 1, sec. 11, effective June 18, 1970.
